image.altText: A jet plane taking off from a remote mine site in the outback.

props.synopsis: Mineral Resources is looking to take a 21-year lease at WA's Kambalda Airport, in a deal set to inject millions of dollars into the local council's coffers.

title.children: Mining giant offers small WA town a multi-million-dollar deal in return for airport control

image.altText: A hand holding a pink vape

props.synopsis: WA says it won't allow vapes to be sold without a prescription, despite new federal regulations allowing it. Yet vapes are still easily obtainable illegally, and the minister won't say how many sellers have been prosecuted.

title.children: WA to toughen vape laws again — but minister still won't say how many shops have been prosecuted for illegal sales

image.altText: book ban council

props.synopsis: City of Albany councillors voted 8-3 not to remove sex education books Sex: A Book for Teens and not restrict access to the award-winning Welcome to Sex at its public library.

title.children: Council rejects call to remove sex education books from public library

image.altText: A woman waist deep in a pool with a child swimming and two children sitting on the edge

props.synopsis: The state government announcement of free kids' summer swimming lessons led to a rush in enrolments and many parents are unhappy that their children will now miss out.

title.children: Kids' summer swimming lessons swiftly book out in WA after fees waived, prompting backlash

image.altText: a hand reaches for a red cup filled with beef jerky

props.synopsis: With a growing emphasis on healthy, protein-rich diets among families and households, consumers are turning to alternative approaches to snacking on the go.

title.children: Country shop clearing $10,000 worth of beef jerky a week as diet and consumer demands shift

image.altText: A dead cattle's skull resting against a tree, rusty lighting

props.synopsis: Allegations of animal welfare issues and financial mismanagement have plagued the Kimberley Meat Company in WA's north for nearly a decade. Now it has shut down owing more than $100 million.

title.children: 'Appalling': Local businesses out of pocket after abattoir shuts down owing $103 million

image.altText: A man with black hair and a long black beard in a shirt with glasses stands in front of buildings

props.synopsis: The death of a friend in jail by suicide prompted former inmate Kelvin Whitwell to become a counsellor on the outside. Now he's calling for WA's prison system to be reformed.

title.children: Former inmate calls for intervention to halt spiralling WA prison conditions

image.altText: A woman in a grocery isle of fruit and vegetables

props.synopsis: The annual rate of headline inflation fell to 2.7 per cent in August, down from 3.5 per cent in July. The Australian share market closed lower. Look back on the day's events and insights with our specialist business reporters.

title.children: Inflation falls to within RBA's target limit but economists cautious about overall picture, ASX closes lower — as it happened

image.altText: Anthony Albanese in courtyard

props.synopsis: The prime minister declined to rebuff suggestions he planned to revisit the policy ahead of the election and said he would be comfortable with the public service examining proposals.

title.children: Albanese leaves the door open to Labor revisiting negative gearing, declining to rule out changes

image.altText: A cloud of smoke over a city skyline in the background; a beach in the foreground.

props.synopsis: Israel's military said the air strikes into southern Lebanon killed a top Hezbollah commander, while Lebanon's foreign minister said the strikes killed more than 560 people and left an estimated half a million people displaced, urging the US to intervene and help halt the fighting.

title.children: Hezbollah launches its first ballistic missile strike in year-long conflict as Israel barrages Lebanon for third day

image.altText: Houses under construction on a bright, sunny day

props.synopsis: The policy that just won't quit is back. Will Labor revisit its 2016 and 2019 election policies?

title.children: We're talking about negative gearing again, but why is it such a big deal?

image.altText: Joe Biden stands in front of a green wall and holds up a hand.

props.synopsis: World leaders are gathering in New York this week with a growing list of conflicts and crises to discuss. Here are some takeaways from the first day of debate at the UN General Assembly.

title.children: Warned of a 'powder keg that risks engulfing the world', global leaders gather at the UN

image.altText: A woman holding a young child.

props.synopsis: Medicare is now covering just over half of specialist fees, forcing Australians to increasingly dip into their own pockets and delay vital care.

title.children: Experts warn Medicare rebates for specialists 'almost meaningless'

image.altText: Portraits of nine women looking serious are arranged in a grid.

props.synopsis: Thousands of Australian women who won a landmark class action settlement more than a year ago over damage done by pelvic mesh have still not received any compensation.

title.children: More than a year after their $300 million settlement, these women have still not received any money

image.altText: A crowd of out-of-focus people walk in front of a large in-focus Coles supermarket sign.

props.synopsis: You can't have missed the parade of political figures this year lining up to take a kick at the nation's biggest supermarket chains, Coles and Woolworths, who jointly control about 65 per cent of the grocery market.

title.children: It's a good ol' fashioned game of 'stacks on' for Coles and Woolworths

image.altText: Two men standing around farming machinery

props.synopsis: In his first day on the job Charles Burke has laid down the gauntlet to major supermarkets with his newly-installed power to report behaviours and business practices that hurt farmers and consumers.

title.children: Food farmers' commissioner to take on 'mafia tactics' of Coles and Woolies

image.altText: An electric vehicle by Geely is seen displayed at a car showroom.

props.synopsis: The federal government says it is in contact with the US about the new moves it has put up against Chinese car companies.

title.children: The US government is effectively banning Chinese-made cars from its roads. Some in Australia want the government to take notice

image.altText: Sri Lankan Tamil woman Cammy Joseph sitting at a table

props.synopsis: The island nation's new president Anura Dissanayake heralded a "new era of renaissance" as he was sworn in on Monday. Here is how the Sri Lankan diaspora are responding.

title.children: Some Sri Lankans say their new left-wing president is 'a clean guy', but others have mixed feelings

image.altText: A photo of missing woman Samantha Murphy in a formal floral dress.

props.synopsis: Specialist teams have searched an area riddled with undocumented mines, just kilometres from where Ms Murphy's mobile phone was found in May.

title.children: Police revisit previously searched areas in hunt for missing woman Samantha Murphy

image.altText: Two boys

props.synopsis: Russell and Ben Smith were found dead in their Faulconbridge home earlier this month. Their mother has since been charged with two counts of domestic violence-related murder.

title.children: 'An absolute privilege to be your father': Hundreds gather to farewell boys allegedly murdered by their mother

image.altText: Patrick Cripps kisses the Brownlow Medal on stage

props.synopsis: The existing record for most votes in a single season was broken twice in this year's Brownlow Medal count, but AFL CEO Andrew Dillon remains confident in the umpires' ability to read the game.

title.children: 'We trust our umpires implicitly': AFL resists Brownlow Medal voting overhaul despite record-breaking Cripps haul

image.altText: Women in dresses standing and one lady sitting on the floor

props.synopsis: The Netflix-inspired event is drawing comparisons to the infamous Willy Wonka experience fiasco earlier this year.

title.children: Bridgerton fans paid hundreds of dollars for a themed ball in Detroit. Here's why they weren't impressed

image.altText: A hand holding a phone

props.synopsis: The Bureau of Meteorology says there is no tsunami headed to Australia after sending a false warning to half the country earlier today.

title.children: Bureau of Meteorology says no tsunami headed for Australia after sending false watch warning

image.altText: Black outline of woman with arms pressed up against the corner of two walls, against a pink background.

props.synopsis: For the thousands of Australians caring for dependant kids and sick parents, the impact on their physical and mental health is significant. So what can be done about it?

title.children: With an aging population and children staying at home longer, the 'Sandwich Generation' are struggling

image.altText: A shot of downtown Whitesburg shows red brick buildings and cars lining a street

props.synopsis: A small US town has been rocked after a district court judge was shot and killed in his chambers. A sheriff and long-time colleague has been charged with his murder.

title.children: The case of a sheriff accused of murdering a judge in his chambers is captivating Americans

image.altText: A blonde woman smiling and holding a goat.

props.synopsis: Devastated family members were unaware she had even left the Royal Brisbane and Women's Hospital unit when they were told the much loved 41-year old's body had been found on a beach, north of Brisbane.

title.children: 'No one was told' their sister was being discharged from a mental health ward and days later she took her own life

image.altText: An SA Police car drives on a city street.

props.synopsis: A South Australian man who allegedly inflicted injuries to the baby boy in July has been arrested today and charged with manslaughter.

title.children: Man to face court over death of seven-week-old baby

image.altText: A court sketch of Ryan W. Routh, suspected of attempting to assassinate Donald Trump.

props.synopsis: The US Department of Justice has charged Ryan Routh, the suspected gunman who staked out Donald Trump at Florida golf course, with attempting an assassination.

title.children: Ryan Routh charged with attempted assassination of Trump

image.altText: Will Ashcroft and Kai Lohmann hug after a goal is scored for the Lions

props.synopsis: A long-standing ovation is given to Sydney and Geelong for their masterful recruiting and player development, but Brisbane has produced a post-COVID scouting masterclass which could deliver their first premiership in 21 years.

title.children: Brisbane's post-COVID masterclass puts them on the brink of premiership glory

image.altText: Recording artist Sean "Puff Daddy" Combs, ring detail, attends the grand opening weekend at Omnia Nightclub

props.synopsis: Sean “Diddy” Combs has been a revered artist and entrepreneur in the world of hip hop since the early '90s. Now, he’s awaiting trial on charges of sex trafficking and racketeering. How did we get here?

title.children: What’s happening with Diddy? The past, present and future of Sean Combs

image.altText: A couple smiling in a black and white photo, holding a baby.

props.synopsis: A man accused of murdering a top paediatrician and the woman alleged to have helped him cover up the crime have been ordered to stand trial in the Supreme Court.

title.children: Duo accused in connection to death of top doctor plead not guilty

image.altText: A Thai LGBT advocate standing in front of a rainbow balloon.

props.synopsis: Thai King Maha Vajiralongkorn signs same-sex marriage into law, making Thailand the first country in South-East Asia to recognise marriage equality for same-sex couples.

title.children: 'Monumental step': Thailand legalises same-sex marriage as king signs landmark equality bill into law

image.altText: A man holds a large knife and looks at the camera with a neutral expression.

props.synopsis: Teenagers in England and Wales are twice as likely to be killed by a knife now than they were 10 years ago and as violent knife crime continues to rise the UK takes measures like a buy-back scheme similar to Australia's after the Port Arthur massacre.

title.children: UK authorities want these 'zombie knives' off the streets and they're hoping something borrowed from Australia will help

image.altText: Composite image of Patrick Cripps playing for Carlton and for the Northampton Rams at age 12 in 2007.

props.synopsis: When Barry Mitchell first picked up a camera 20 years ago to help out the local footy awards night, little did he know he would be capturing a moment in AFL history.

title.children: Country photographer's archive captures a 'field day' from 12-year-old Patrick Cripps
